page.title: 18LOCAL HISTORY 2
page.content: The people of the area are proud that every acre of land here has {historic {associations.}Some of them play an active role with Archaeologists in keeping watch over the phenomina of{ {crop-marks}which show history written on the fields each spring. It was a local Farmer who discoved first the Roman, and then the Iron Age sites at {Highstead.}When these were excavated, relations between Archaeologists and the Community were excellent. Some finds including a mould for casting bronze pins (Iron Age) were stolen during a break-in, but this was thought to be the work of 'outsiders'. Long after the excavations have ended the locals still keep{collections}of flints and pot sherds that they come across during their daily round for periodic collection by the archaeologists.
